intro: Ehretia dicksonii var. liukiuensis, commonly known as the Liukiu ehretia, is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It belongs to the Elaeocarpaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy beneath. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
